info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 2:42PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Routt County through 315 PM MDT... At 242 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hayden, or 19 miles east of Craig, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Routt County, including the following locations... Tow Creek. This includes U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 107 and 120. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
